Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: I noticed that the activities 'Verify Documents' and 'Call Customer' appear multiple times in different cases. I identified these as recurring activities needing renaming based on context.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: By carefully analyzing the event log details, such as timestamps, resources, and additional context, I inferred that the meaning of the recurring activities changes based on their position and associated details.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: I hypothesized that renaming activities to include context-related descriptions, such as 'Initial Document Verification' or 'Post-Adjustment Verification,' could make their roles clear.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I reasoned that consistent naming based on activity context (e.g., initial, re-verification, follow-up) would make the process more understandable and disambiguate recurring activity names.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I systematically validated each renaming by cross-referencing with provided contexts, such as whether the activity occurred after an adjustment or was an initial occurrence.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: When considering naming for 'Verify Documents' and 'Call Customer,' I revisited previous cases (e.g., C001 vs. C002) to ensure consistency and fit for varying contexts (like post-adjustment or initial phases).
